relatedanime.anime: Nobunaga no Shinobi: Ise Kanegasaki Hen

similaranime.anime: Ninin ga Shinobuden: The Nonsense Kunoichi Fiction

anime.description: The anime centers on a young female ninja named Chidori, whose dream is to help the Warring States-era warlord Oda Nobunaga to achieve his goals.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: horny nosebleed
tag.description: In Japanese media, healthy young men who have no other sexual outlet will often suffer nosebleeds upon seeing the naked female body, or even just a pair of well-filled panties. The nosebleed is, of course, a visual shorthand/euphemism for sexual arousal. It is commonly interpreted that way for males and females, with little trickles of blood indicating mild arousal, and gushing fountains of blood indicating erection/extreme arousal in both sexes. It can also be interpreted as shorthand strictly for erections in males. In that case, when blood shoots from the nose explosively, and in ridiculous quantity, the implication would be an ejaculation. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: bad cooking
tag.description: The character is hopelessly terrible at cooking, and any attempts he or she makes at making even the simplest dishes are spectacular failures.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: ninja
tag.description: A ninja was a covert agent or mercenary of feudal Japan specializing in unorthodox arts of war. The functions of the ninja included espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, as well as open combat in certain situations. The ninja, using covert methods of waging war, were contrasted with the samurai, who had strict rules about honor and combat.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Kyoto
tag.description: Kyoto Prefecture is a prefecture of Japan in the Kansai region of the island of Honshu. The capital is the city of Kyoto. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Sengoku period
tag.description: The Sengoku period (戦国時代, Sengoku jidai) or Warring States period in Japanese history was a time of social upheaval, political intrigue, and nearly constant military conflict that lasted roughly from the middle of the 15th century to the beginning of the 17th century. The name "Sengoku" was adopted by Japanese historians in reference to the Warring States period in Chinese history (Sengoku jidai (戦国時代) in Japanese) which preceded the unification of China. Likewise, the Sengoku period in Japan would eventually lead to the unification of political power under the Tokugawa shogunate.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: feudal warfare
tag.description: Feudal Warfare is the warfare of the Middle Ages and therefore the setting must take place in a time line similar to that of Middle Ages or its Asian/American counterparts, or in a fantasy world. Generally it can be described the same way as the Military category, just that the weapons used are swords, spears, bows, catapults, cannons and other weapons used in the Middle Ages. Note: Just because the anime contains a guy or a couple of guys with swords wondering about, doesn`t make it applicable for this category, unless there are larger military organizations/groups involved in armed conflict with each other, you might not want to add this genre.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: 4-koma manga
tag.description: Yonkoma manga (4コマ漫画, four cell manga, or 4-koma for short), a comic-strip format, generally consists of gag comic strips within four panels of equal size ordered from top to bottom. (They also sometimes run right-to-left horizontally or use a hybrid 2x2 style, depending on the layout requirements of the publication in which they appear.) Though the word yonkoma comes from the Japanese, the style also exists outside of Japan in other Asian countries as well as in the English-speaking market.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

episode.title: サルとツンデレ娘
The Monkey and the Tsundere Girl
Le singe et la pimbêche
Saru to Tsundere Musume
episode.summary: Chidori and Sukezo go to visit Hideyoshi, who has gotten sick. While they`re there, Hideyoshi`s friend, Nene, barges in. It seems that Nene secretly has feelings for Hideyoshi, but Hideyoshi likes Nobunaga`s younger sister, Oichi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 突撃!! となりの今川さん
Attack!! Imagawa-san Next Door
À l’attaque ! Mon voisin Imagawa
Totsugeki!! Tonari no Imagawa-san
episode.summary: Nobunaga`s first mission for Chidori is to go find out information about Imagawa Yoshimoto`s plans to infiltrate Owari. That night, Chidori successfully infiltrates Imagawa`s mansion and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 織田家とゆかいな仲間たち
The Oda Clan and Their Merry Friends
La famille Oda et de joyeux compagnons
Odake to Yukai na Nakama-tachi
episode.summary: While at Oda`s castle, a man called Saru, whose name is actually Kinoshita Hideyoshi, appears before her. He keeps bugging her to him ninja techniques and another Oda subordinate, Mori Yoshinari, who is a master of the spear, asks her to spar with him. What does Chidori do? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 信長様に会いに行こう
Let`s Go See Nobunaga-sama
À la rencontre du seigneur Nobunaga
Nobunaga-sama ni Ai ni Ikou
episode.summary: Chidori, the Iga shinobi, may only be a child, but was already a skilled shinobi. One day, her master gets a request from Oda Nobunaga to send some shinobi to work for him. Chidori is picked to go, and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 信長と見習い忍び
Ninja Girl & Samurai Master
Les ninjas de Nobunaga
Nobunaga to Minarai Shinobi
episode.summary: Oda Nobunaga saves a girl from drowning one day. She clumsily tells him that she`s a shinobi. Instead of attempting to kill him, she swears to serve him one day after hearing his plans to unify Japan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歴史に人あり
History Is Full of People
L’Histoire est faite d’hommes
Rekishi ni Hito Ari
episode.summary: Because of his amazing turnaround win against Imagawa, Nobunaga`s name is spread across the land. After they get back, a man who calls himself Ota Gyuichi and apparently loves history, asks Chidori about her involvement in Nobunaga`s victory, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 桶狭間の中心で, 義元がさけぶ
In the Center of Okehazama, Yoshimoto Yells
Le cri de Yoshimoto en plein Okehazama
Okehazama no Chuushin de, Yoshimoto ga Sakebu
episode.summary: Despite being at a complete disadvantage against Imagawa`s army, Nobunaga and his troops advance towards Imagawa`s main army. Chidori locates Imagawa, and informs Nobunaga and they finally have him in their sights. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 千鳥, 鳥の如く
Chidori, Like a Bird
Chidori, tel un oiseau
Chidori, Tori no Gotoku
episode.summary: Nobunaga dances to "Atsumori," and heads into battle. However, Imagawa`s army of 25,000 easily capture more than one of his fortresses. Meanwhile, Nobunaga patiently waited for a report from Chidori on the front lines... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今川軍がやってきた
The Imagawa Army Arrives
Imagawa est arrivé
Imagawa Gun ga Yatte Kita
episode.summary: Imagawa Yoshimoto starts his invasion of Owari. Nobunaga`s army was panicking, but Nobunaga was calm for some reason. Meanwhile, Chidori was doing an important mission for Nobunaga. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才は病弱さん
The Genius Is Sickly
Le génie est maladif
Tensai wa Byoujaku-san
episode.summary: The person who ended up treating Chidori`s wounds was Takenaka Hanbee himself. Chidori wields her kunai to kill the person who saved her life, but she ends up developing some feelings toward Hanbee, and... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 上司にめぐまれなかったら
If Your Boss Doesn`t Favor You
Si on n’a pas un bon supérieur
Joushi ni Megumarenakattara
episode.summary: Nobunaga starts his advance into Mino. The daimyo of Mino, Saito Tatsuoki, is a good-for-nothing, but his forces included the Mino Three and the genius strategist, Takenaka Hanbee. Their combination proves to be powerful, and Nobunaga is forced to retreat. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美濃を制す者は天下を制す
The One Who Rules Mino Rules the Land
Celui qui domine Mino dominera le monde
Mino o Seisu Mono wa Tenka o Seisa
episode.summary: The Mino Three get tired of Tatsuoki`s constant partying. Chidori goes to Mino to assassinate Takenaka Hanbee, but the Mino Three find her! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 清洲同盟と元康の忍び
The Kiyosu Alliance and Motoyasu`s Shinobi
L’alliance de Kiyosu et le ninja de Motoyasu
Kiyosu Doumei to Motoyasu no Shinobi
episode.summary: The daimyo of Mikawa, Matsudaira Motoyasu was finally able to break ties with the Imagawa Clan that he was forced to serve for years. He arrives at Kiyosu Castle to form an alliance with Nobunaga. Chidori seems extremely interested in meeting Hattori Hanzo, who serves Motoyasu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風雲!! 稲葉山城!!
The Situation at Inabayama Castle!!
Tempête sur le château Inabayama
Fuuun!! Inabayama Jou!!
episode.summary: Hanbee suddenly says they should take over Inabayama Castle and is easily able to do so with just Chidori and 16 men. Hanbee manages to put the whole castle into a panicked frenzy, and seizes Tatsuoki... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一夜で築いた事にしとい!!
Let`s Just Say It Got Built Overnight!!
Fais comme si on l’avait construit en une nuit
Ichiya de Kizuita Koto ni Shitoi!!
episode.summary: Building a castle in Sunomata starts to go pretty well for Hideyoshi. However, they are then attacked by Saito’s forces. Since Hideyoshi and the others spent the last three nights trying to build this castle with no rest, they are put in a difficult situation... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなで築こう墨俣城
Let`s All Build Sunomata Castle
Construisons le château Sunomata ensemble
Minna de Kizukou Sunomata Jou
episode.summary: In order to build a castle in Sunomata, Hideyoshi asks Hachisuka Koroku for help. However, Koroku doesn’t agree very easily. Hideyoshi then tells him of his ambitions to try to get him to agree to help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出世は大変でござ~る
Moving Up in the World Is Hard
Il est dur d’être promu
Shusse wa Taihen de Gozaru
episode.summary: Maeda Toshiie and Matsu are a happy and successful couple. Nene sees them and tells Hideyoshi to hurry up and move up the ranks, as well. Meanwhile, Nobunaga devises a plan to build a castle in Sunomata in order to invade Mino, and Hideyoshi takes on the task. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妹よ
My Little Sister
Petite sœur
Imouto yo
episode.summary: Takenaka Hanbee becomes Hideyoshi’s strategist and tells them that in order for the Oda Clan to grow, they would need to acquire the road to Omi. Nobunaga then decides to offer his younger sister, Oichi, to Asai Nagamasa, a daimyo in northern Omi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 半兵衛ゲットだ!!
We Got Takenaka Hanbee!!
On a Hanbei dans la poche !
Hanbeichou Get Da!!
episode.summary: Hideyoshi and Chidori go to ask Takenaka Hanbee to work for the Oda Clan, but he refuses. However, after hearing Hideyoshi speak of his dream and Chidori’s persuasion skills, his resolve starts to waver... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 京が俺を呼んでるぜ
Kyo Is Calling Me
Kyoto m’appelle
Miyako ga Ore o Yonderuze
episode.summary: While the construction of Gifu Castle and its town are going as planned, Nobunaga, who is planning to head to the capital, summons Hideyoshi and Chidori. He orders them to go summon Takenaka Hanbee, who is currently enjoying a quiet retired life, to join their forces. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 引きこもり終了のお知らせ
Notice of the End of Being a Shut-In
Fin d’une vie de réclusion
Hikikomori Shuuryou no Oshirase
episode.summary: With the Mino Three now on his side, Nobunaga attacks Inabayama Castle. Tatsuoki ends up letting the Oda forces into the castle and loses his mind and goes to look for the women who always waited on him. However, the woman he found was... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おいでやす京へ
Welcome to Kyo
Bienvenue à Kyoto
Oideyasu Kyou e
episode.summary: Nobunaga finally gets to Kyoto and orders Shibata Katsuie and Mori Yoshinari to stamp out the Miyoshi Three. Now that unifying the land is becoming a close reality, Chidori starts to wonder if it’s all right for her to be by Nobunaga’s side since she came from a different province... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 城とったどー!!
We Took the Castle!!
On a pris le château !
Shiro Totta Dou!!
episode.summary: In order to defeat Rokkaku Shotei, Hideyoshi, Sakuma, and Tanba attack Mitsukuri Castle. Rokkaku was convinced that they would try to attack Wadayama Castle that was on the front lines. Despite being attacked, the men at Mitsukuri Castle do what they can to fight back. It’s then that Takenaka Hanbee comes up with a new strategy... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 影の伝説
The Legend of the Shadow
La légende de l’ombre
Kage no Densetsu
episode.summary: Nobunaga is headed to Kyoto and sends messengers to Rokkaku Shotei in southern Oumi, but he refuses to help in any way. Feeling like he has no other choice, Nobunaga heads to southern Oumi with an army of 60,000. However, the Rokkaku Clan had the 53 Leaders of Koga working with them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 信長! うしろ!! うしろ!!
Nobunaga!! Behind You!! Behind You!!
Nobunaga ! Derrière vous !
Nobunaga! Ushiro!! Ushiro!!
episode.summary: Endo Naotsune, who is not very fond of Nobunaga, finds out that he is going to stop by to see his sister on his way to Kyoto and plans his assassination. Having no idea about this plot, Nobunaga and the others head to Sawayama Castle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ツッコミ師参入
The Straight Man Appears
La visite du maître de la répartie
Tsukkomi Shi Sannyuu
episode.summary: After leaving the Asakura clan behind and coming to work for the Oda clan, Akechi Mitsuhide tells Nobunaga that he’ll set up a meeting with him and Ashikaga Yoshiaki. Nobunaga agrees to this because he wants to take advantage of the shogun’s authority. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いつか将軍になりた~い!!
Someday I Want to Be the Shogun!!
Je veux devenir shogun un jour !
Itsuka Shougun ni Naritai!!
episode.summary: The previous Shogun’s younger brother, Ashikaga Yoshiaki, wants to become the next shogun. He tells the Asakura Clan, who had been sheltering him, that he is going to go see Nobunaga. Source: crunchyroll
